definitions: A group of English Protestants in the 16th and 17th centuries who sought to purify the Church of England from what they considered to be Roman Catholic practices, believing that the Church of England was only partially reformed.
Those who hold extreme moral or religious views, especially those who are censorious of others.
examples: Many Puritans emigrated to North America in the 17th century.
The Puritans established strict moral codes in their communities.
Some view the group as overly rigid, while others admire the Puritans' dedication.
